p: Usually, angiosperm cp genomes are highly conserved in length, structure, gene number, and gene order ( Jansen and Ruhlman, 2012). IR contraction and expansion cause the length of the genome to vary ( Raubeson et al., 2007). Here, we compared six Boraginaceae cp genomes, including Arnebia and Lithospermum, against F. suspensa (family Oleaceae) as reference ( Supplementary Figure 5). The six Boraginaceae cp genomes were well conserved in terms of gene order and positions. Moreover, except for T. plicata, they all indicated IR contraction. Specifically, rps2 was located in LSC/IRa and ycf1 was identified in the IRa/SSC junction, which overlapped with ndhF. These findings revealed the occurrence of IR contraction and expansion, as well as their effect on genome length.
